main

Class AIA

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.AIA

  • public abstract class AIA
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for the algorithm.
    Author:
    Cory Edwards

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DEBUG
      Used to determine if debugging is needed.
      static Nodes NODE_LIST
      A always existing list of all of the Nodes in the algorithm.

      AIA()

      How the program will calculate the score to give to Q learning when a policy is being made.

      void updateProbabilities()

    • Field Detail

      • NODE_LIST

        public static final Nodes NODE_LIST
        A always existing list of all of the Nodes in the algorithm. Analogous to a jar holding every Node, and the Nodes are free of each other in the jar.

      • DEBUG

        public static boolean DEBUG
        Used to determine if debugging is needed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AIA

        public AIA()

    • Method Detail

      • performAction

        public java.lang.Object performAction(java.lang.Object state)
        Main method to the algorithm. Call this on every iteration and the algorithm does the rest.
        Parameters:
        state - The current state in the process the algorithm is running in.
        Returns:
        The next step to take in the process.

      • updateProbabilities

        public void updateProbabilities()
        Use lastNodeId and lastStepId to call: NODE_LIST.getNode(lastNodeId).recalcProb(); Alternatively, someone could override this method and give a probability rather than calculating it. This could be done by calling .giveProb(new probability) instead of .recalcProb().

      • isSuccess

        public abstract boolean isSuccess(Node lastNode,
                                  java.lang.Object newNodeState)
        When a path's action is performed, it will try and see if it was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        lastNode - The winning child Node from the last iteration.
        newNodeState - The new state in the current iteration.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the child Node taken was successful.

      • calculateScore

        public abstract int calculateScore(java.lang.Object state)
        How the program will calculate the score to give to Q learning when a policy is being made.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to get the score from.
        Returns:
        The score that will go along with this state.

      • areStatesEqual

        public abstract boolean areStatesEqual(java.lang.Object stateA,
                                       java.lang.Object stateB)
        Parameters:
        stateA - A Node's state.
        stateB - The new state.
        Returns:
        True if and only if stateA = stateB

      • setChildren

        public abstract long[] setChildren(java.lang.Object state)
        Use the given state and NODE_LIST to create all of the children from the state, and return a list of their Ids.
        Parameters:
        state - The parent's state
        Returns:
        A long[] of all of the newly created child Ids.
